intro: Morilandia crenata, commonly known as the serrated morilandia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive serrated leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Morilandia crenata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
